titleStmt.title: Variants of ǧāʔ inflection: 3.PL.M/C in PFV
titleStmt.author: Veronika Engler

sourceDesc.p: This is the feature-file for ǧāʔ inflection: 3.PL.M/C in PFV

revisionDesc.change: For EGY-___ there are no values found

wib:featureValueObservation.note: Very old speakers (70+) use ǧam in combination with ʔiǧu / ʔižu.
In general middle age and young speakers show ʔižu and only older speakers may show ʔiǧu.
Cantineau gives also a second reflex ǧo'u
preferred form in third Person forms with vowel-initial suffixes; e.g. yēt-əč (I came to you.)
